br.usp.poli.takiyama.acfove
Class ACFOVETest.WaterSprinklerNetworkTest

java.lang.Object
  br.usp.poli.takiyama.acfove.ACFOVETest.WaterSprinklerNetworkTest
Enclosing class:
ACFOVETest
public static class ACFOVETest.WaterSprinklerNetworkTest
extends java.lang.Object

Some tests involving the lifted version of the water sprinkler network. Data structures used in test cases from this class are created by WaterSprinklerNetwork class.

Constructor Summary

Method Detail

queryWetGrass

public void queryWetGrass()
Network: water sprinkler Query: wet_grass(Lot) Evidence: none Population size: n >= 5 For n < 5, the algorithm propositionalizes the logical variable Lot because it is cheaper than counting it. In the end, the result will be propositionalized. This test assumes the answer is lifted so it is easier to compare with the expected result. Last time I checked the answer is correct for n < 5 too.

queryRainGivenWetGrassWithOneLot

public void queryRainGivenWetGrassWithOneLot()
Network: water sprinkler Query: rain() Evidence: wet_grass(lot0) = true Population size: 1 Even though the answer is consistent, the real probability is obtained by dividing the result by the normalizing constant. I thought AC-FOVE results did not need this kind of correction. Is it correct? TODO Check the need for normalizing constants

querySprinklerGivenWetGrassWithOneLot

public void querySprinklerGivenWetGrassWithOneLot()
Network: water sprinkler Query: sprinkler(lot0) Evidence: wet_grass(lot0) = true Population size: 1 Even though the answer is consistent, the real probability is obtained by dividing the result by the normalizing constant. I thought AC-FOVE results did not need this kind of correction. Is it correct? TODO Check the need for normalizing constants
